member.summary: Defines how the value is determined for position before first point or after the end point on the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveLoopType.Constant
member.summary: The value of will be evaluated as first point for positions before the beginning and end point for positions after the end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveLoopType.Cycle
member.summary: The positions will wrap around from the end to beginning of the for determined the value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveLoopType.CycleOffset
member.summary: The positions will wrap around from the end to beginning of the . The value will be offset by the difference between the values of first and end multiplied by the wrap amount. If the position is before the beginning of the the difference will be subtracted from its value; otherwise the difference will be added.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveLoopType.Oscillate
member.summary: The value at the end of the act as an offset from the same side of the toward the opposite side.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveLoopType.Linear
member.summary: The linear interpolation will be performed for determined the value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveTangent.Flat
member.summary: The tangent which always has a value equal to zero.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveTangent.Linear
member.summary: The tangent which contains a difference between current tangent value and the tangent value from the previous .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.CurveTangent.Smooth
member.summary: The smoouth tangent which contains the inflection between and by taking into account the values of both neighbors of the .

member.summary: Gets or sets the current environment map texture.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.EnvironmentMapAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the environment map RGB that will be blended over the base texture. Range 0 to 1, default 1. If set to zero, the RGB channels of the environment map will completely ignored (but the environment map alpha may still be visible if EnvironmentMapSpecular is greater than zero).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.EnvironmentMapSpecular
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the environment map alpha channel that will be added to the base texture. Range 0 to 1, default 0. This can be used to implement cheap specular lighting, by encoding one or more specular highlight patterns into the environment map alpha channel, then setting EnvironmentMapSpecular to the desired specular light color.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EnvironmentMapEffect.FresnelFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Fresnel factor used for the environment map blending. Higher values make the environment map only visible around the silhouette edges of the object, while lower values make it visible everywhere. Setting this property to 0 disables Fresnel entirely, making the environment map equally visible regardless of view angle. The default is 1. Fresnel only affects the environment map RGB (the intensity of which is controlled by EnvironmentMapAmount). The alpha contribution (controlled by EnvironmentMapSpecular) is not affected by the Fresnel setting.

member.summary: This effect requires lighting, so we explicitly implement IEffectLights.LightingEnabled, and do not allow turning it off.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PresentInterval
member.summary: Defines how updates the game window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PresentInterval.Default
member.summary: Equivalent to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PresentInterval.One
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period, before updating window client area. Present operations are not affected more frequently than the screen refresh rate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PresentInterval.Two
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period, before updating window client area. Present operations are not affected more frequently than every second screen refresh.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PresentInterval.Immediate
member.summary: The driver updates the window client area immediately. Present operations might be affected immediately. There is no limit for framerate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType
member.summary: Defines how vertex data is ordered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType.TriangleList
member.summary: Renders the specified vertices as a sequence of isolated triangles. Each group of three vertices defines a separate triangle. Back-face culling is affected by the current winding-order render state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType.TriangleStrip
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a triangle strip. The back-face culling flag is flipped automatically on even-numbered triangles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType.LineList
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a list of isolated straight line segments; the count may be any positive integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType.LineStrip
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a single polyline; the count may be any positive integer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType.PointListEXT
member.summary: Treats each vertex as a single point. Vertex n defines point n. N points are drawn.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetUsage
member.summary: Defines if the previous content in a render target is preserved when it set on the graphics device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetUsage.DiscardContents
member.summary: The render target content will not be preserved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetUsage.PreserveContents
member.summary: The render target content will be preserved even if it is slow or requires extra memory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetUsage.PlatformContents
member.summary: The render target content might be preserved if the platform can do so without a penalty in performance or memory usage.

member.summary: The newly created resource object.

member.summary: The name of the destroyed resource.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ResourceDestroyedEventArgs.Tag
member.summary: The resource manager tag of the destroyed resource.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SetDataOptions
member.summary: Defines how vertex or index buffer data will be flushed during a SetData operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SetDataOptions.None
member.summary: The SetData can overwrite the portions of existing data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SetDataOptions.Discard
member.summary: The SetData will discard the entire buffer. A pointer to a new memory area is returned and rendering from the previous area do not stall.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SetDataOptions.NoOverwrite
member.summary: The SetData operation will not overwrite existing data. This allows the driver to return immediately from a SetData operation and continue rendering.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects
member.summary: Defines sprite visual options for mirroring.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects.None
member.summary: No options specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects.FlipHorizontally
member.summary: Render the sprite reversed along the X axis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects.FlipVertically
member.summary: Render the sprite reversed along the Y axis.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode
member.summary: Defines sprite sort rendering options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Deferred
member.summary: All sprites are drawing when invokes, in order of draw call sequence. Depth is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Immediate
member.summary: Each sprite is drawing at individual draw call, instead of . Depth is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Texture
member.summary: Same as , except sprites are sorted by texture prior to drawing. Depth is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.BackToFront
member.summary: Same as , except sprites are sorted by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.FrontToBack
member.summary: Same as , except sprites are sorted by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend
member.summary: Defines a blend mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.One
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by {1, 1, 1, 1}.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.Zero
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by {0, 0, 0, 0}.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.SourceColor
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the source color. {Rs, Gs, Bs, As}, where Rs, Gs, Bs, As are color source values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceColor
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the source color. {1 - Rs, 1 - Gs, 1 - Bs, 1 - As}, where Rs, Gs, Bs, As are color source values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlpha
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the source. {As, As, As, As}, where As is the source alpha value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceAlpha
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha value of the source. {1 - As, 1 - As, 1 - As, 1 - As}, where As is the source alpha value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.DestinationColor
member.summary: Each component color is multiplied by the destination color. {Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad}, where Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad are color destination values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationColor
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the inversed destination color. {1 - Rd, 1 - Gd, 1 - Bd, 1 - Ad}, where Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad are color destination values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.DestinationAlpha
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the destination. {Ad, Ad, Ad, Ad}, where Ad is the destination alpha value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationAlpha
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by the inversed alpha value of the destination. {1 - Ad, 1 - Ad, 1 - Ad, 1 - Ad}, where Ad is the destination alpha value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.BlendFactor
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by a constant in the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.InverseBlendFactor
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by a inversed constant in the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlphaSaturation
member.summary: Each component of the color is multiplied by either the alpha of the source color, or the inverse of the alpha of the source color, whichever is greater. {f, f, f, 1}, where f = min(As, 1 - As), where As is the source alpha value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction
member.summary: Defines a function for color blending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction.Add
member.summary: The function will add destination to the source. (srcColor * srcBlend) + (destColor * destBlend)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction.Subtract
member.summary: The function will subtract destination from source. (srcColor * srcBlend) - (destColor * destBlend)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction.ReverseSubtract
member.summary: The function will subtract source from destination. (destColor * destBlend) - (srcColor * srcBlend)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction.Max
member.summary: The function will extract minimum of the source and destination. min((srcColor * srcBlend),(destColor * destBlend))

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.BlendFunction.Min
member.summary: The function will extract maximum of the source and destination. max((srcColor * srcBlend),(destColor * destBlend))

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction
member.summary: The comparison function used for depth, stencil, and alpha tests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.Always
member.summary: Always passes the test.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.Never
member.summary: Never passes the test.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.Less
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value is less than current pixel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.LessEqual
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value is less than or equal to current pixel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.Equal
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value is equal to current pixel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.GreaterEqual
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value is greater than or equal to current pixel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.Greater
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value is greater than current pixel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CompareFunction.NotEqual
member.summary: Passes the test when the new pixel value does not equal to current pixel value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CullMode
member.summary: Defines a culling mode for faces in rasterization process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CullMode.None
member.summary: Do not cull faces.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CullMode.CullClockwiseFace
member.summary: Cull faces with clockwise order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.CullMode.CullCounterClockwiseFace
member.summary: Cull faces with counter clockwise order.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.FillMode
member.summary: Defines options for filling the primitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.FillMode.Solid
member.summary: Draw solid faces for each primitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.FillMode.WireFrame
member.summary: Draw lines for each primitive.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation
member.summary: Defines stencil buffer operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Keep
member.summary: Does not update the stencil buffer entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Zero
member.summary: Sets the stencil buffer entry to 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Replace
member.summary: Replaces the stencil buffer entry with a reference value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Increment
member.summary: Increments the stencil buffer entry, wrapping to 0 if the new value exceeds the maximum value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Decrement
member.summary: Decrements the stencil buffer entry, wrapping to the maximum value if the new value is less than 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.IncrementSaturation
member.summary: Increments the stencil buffer entry, clamping to the maximum value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.DecrementSaturation
member.summary: Decrements the stencil buffer entry, clamping to 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.StencilOperation.Invert
member.summary: Inverts the bits in the stencil buffer entry.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureAddressMode
member.summary: Defines modes for addressing texels using texture coordinates that are outside of the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Wrap
member.summary: Texels outside range will form the tile at every integer junction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Clamp
member.summary: Texels outside range will be setted to color of 0.0 or 1.0 texel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Mirror
member.summary: Same as but tiles will also flipped at every integer junction.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter
member.summary: Defines filtering types for texture sampler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.Linear
member.summary: Use linear filtering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.Point
member.summary: Use point filtering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.Anisotropic
member.summary: Use anisotropic filtering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.LinearMipPoint
member.summary: Use linear filtering to shrink or expand, and point filtering between mipmap levels (mip).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.PointMipLinear
member.summary: Use point filtering to shrink (minify) or expand (magnify), and linear filtering between mipmap levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.MinLinearMagPointMipLinear
member.summary: Use linear filtering to shrink, point filtering to expand, and linear filtering between mipmap levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.MinLinearMagPointMipPoint
member.summary: Use linear filtering to shrink, point filtering to expand, and point filtering between mipmap levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.MinPointMagLinearMipLinear
member.summary: Use point filtering to shrink, linear filtering to expand, and linear filtering between mipmap levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.TextureFilter.MinPointMagLinearMipPoint
member.summary: Use point filtering to shrink, linear filtering to expand, and point filtering between mipmap levels.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat
member.summary: Defines types of surface formats.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Color
member.summary: Unsigned 32-bit ARGB pixel format for store 8 bits per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Bgr565
member.summary: Unsigned 16-bit BGR pixel format for store 5 bits for blue, 6 bits for green, and 5 bits for red.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Bgra5551
member.summary: Unsigned 16-bit BGRA pixel format where 5 bits reserved for each color and last bit is reserved for alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Bgra4444
member.summary: Unsigned 16-bit BGRA pixel format for store 4 bits per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Dxt1
member.summary: DXT1. Texture format with compression. Surface dimensions must be a multiple 4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Dxt3
member.summary: DXT3. Texture format with compression. Surface dimensions must be a multiple 4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Dxt5
member.summary: DXT5. Texture format with compression. Surface dimensions must be a multiple 4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.NormalizedByte2
member.summary: Signed 16-bit bump-map format for store 8 bits for u and v data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.NormalizedByte4
member.summary: Signed 16-bit bump-map format for store 8 bits per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SurfaceFormat.Rgba1010102
member.summary: Unsigned 32-bit RGBA pixel format for store 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.TextureDataFromStreamEXT(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads image data from a given stream.
member.remarks: This is an extension of XNA 4 and is not compatible with XNA. It exists to help with dynamically reloading textures while games are running. Games can use this method to read a stream into memory and then call SetData on a texture with that data, rather than having to dispose the texture and recreate it entirely.
member.param: The stream from which to read the image data.
Outputs the width of the image.
Outputs the height of the image.
Outputs the pixel data of the image, in non-premultiplied RGBA format.
Preferred width of the resulting image data
Preferred height of the resulting image data
false to maintain aspect ratio, true to crop image

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.GamePadDeadZone
member.summary: Specifies a type of dead zone processing to apply to the controllers analog sticks when calling GetState.
member.param: The combined X and Y position of each stick is compared to the dead zone. This provides better control than IndependentAxes when the stick is used as a two-dimensional control surface, such as when controlling a character's view in a first-person game.
The X and Y positions of each stick are compared against the dead zone independently. This setting is the default when calling GetState.
The values of each stick are not processed and are returned by GetState as "raw" values. This is best if you intend to implement your own dead zone processing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper
member.summary: Contains commonly used precalculated values and mathematical operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.E
member.summary: Represents the mathematical constant e(2.71828175).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Log10E
member.summary: Represents the log base ten of e(0.4342945).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Log2E
member.summary: Represents the log base two of e(1.442695).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Pi
member.summary: Represents the value of pi(3.14159274).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.PiOver2
member.summary: Represents the value of pi divided by two(1.57079637).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.PiOver4
member.summary: Represents the value of pi divided by four(0.7853982).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.TwoPi
member.summary: Represents the value of pi times two(6.28318548).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Barycentric(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the Cartesian coordinate for one axis of a point that is defined by a given triangle and two normalized barycentric (areal) coordinates.
member.param: The coordinate on one axis of vertex 1 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 2 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 3 of the defining triangle.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b2, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 2, the coordinate of which is specified in value2.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b3, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 3, the coordinate of which is specified in value3.
member.returns: Cartesian coordinate of the specified point with respect to the axis being used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.CatmullRom(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a Catmull-Rom interpolation using the specified positions.
member.param: The first position in the interpolation.
The second position in the interpolation.
The third position in the interpolation.
The fourth position in the interpolation.
member.returns: A position that is the result of the Catmull-Rom interpolation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Clamp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Restricts a value to be within a specified range.
member.param: The minimum value. If value is less than min, min will be returned.
The maximum value. If value is greater than max, max will be returned.
member.returns: The clamped value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Distance(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute value of the difference of two values.
member.returns: Distance between the two values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Hermite(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a Hermite spline interpolation.
member.returns: The result of the Hermite spline interpolation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.Lerp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of value2.
member.returns: Interpolated value.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. value1 + (value2 - value1) * amount Passing amount a value of 0 will cause value1 to be returned, a value of 1 will cause value2 to be returned.

member.name: T:SDL2.SDL
member.summary: Entry point for all SDL-related (non-extension) types and methods

member.name: F:SDL2.SDL.nativeLibName
member.summary: Used by DllImport to load the native library.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.INTERNAL_SDL_RWFromFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this function to create a new SDL_RWops structure for reading from and/or writing to a named file.
member.param: a UTF-8 string representing the filename to open
an ASCII string representing the mode to be used for opening the file; see Remarks for details
member.returns: Returns a pointer to the SDL_RWops structure that is created, or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_SetMainReady
member.summary: Use this function to circumvent failure of SDL_Init() when not using SDL_main() as an entry point.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_Init(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use this function to initialize the SDL library. This must be called before using any other SDL function.
member.param: subsystem initialization flags; see Remarks for details
member.returns: Returns 0 on success or a negative error code on failure. Call for more information.
member.remarks: The Event Handling, File I/O, and Threading subsystems are initialized by default. You must specifically initialize other subsystems if you use them in your application.
Unless the SDL_INIT_NOPARACHUTE flag is set, it will install cleanup signal handlers for some commonly ignored fatal signals (like SIGSEGV).

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_InitSubSystem(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use this function to initialize specific SDL subsystems.
member.param: any of the flags used by SDL_Init(); see Remarks for details
member.returns: Returns 0 on success or a negative error code on failure. Call for more information.
member.remarks: After SDL has been initialized with you may initialize uninitialized subsystems with .
If you want to initialize subsystems separately you would call followed by with the desired subsystem flag.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_Quit
member.summary: Use this function to clean up all initialized subsystems. You should call it upon all exit conditions.
member.remarks: You should call this function even if you have already shutdown each initialized subsystem with .
If you start a subsystem using a call to that subsystem's init function (for example ) instead of or , then you must use that subsystem's quit function () to shut it down before calling .
You can use this function with atexit() to ensure that it is run when your application is shutdown, but it is not wise to do this from a library or other dynamically loaded code.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_WasInit(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use this function to return a mask of the specified subsystems which have previously been initialized.
member.param: any of the flags used by ; see Remarks for details
member.returns: If flags is 0 it returns a mask of all initialized subsystems, otherwise it returns the initialization status of the specified subsystems. The return value does not include SDL_INIT_NOPARACHUTE.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_ClearHints
member.summary: Use this function to clear all hints.
member.remarks: This function is automatically called during .

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetHint(System.String)
member.summary: Use this function to get the value of a hint.
member.param: the hint to query; see the list of hints on CategoryHints for details
member.returns: Returns the string value of a hint or NULL if the hint isn't set.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_SetHint(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this function to set a hint with normal priority.
member.param: the hint to query; see the list of hints on CategoryHints for details
the value of the hint variable
member.returns: Returns SDL_TRUE if the hint was set, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
member.remarks: Hints will not be set if there is an existing override hint or environment variable that takes precedence. You can use to set the hint with override priority instead.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_SetHintWithPriority(System.String,System.String,SDL2.SDL.SDL_HintPriority)
member.summary: Use this function to set a hint with a specific priority.
member.param: the hint to query; see the list of hints on CategoryHints for details
the value of the hint variable
member.returns: Returns SDL_TRUE if the hint was set, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
member.remarks: The priority controls the behavior when setting a hint that already has a value. Hints will replace existing hints of their priority and lower. Environment variables are considered to have override priority.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_ClearError
member.summary: Use this function to clear any previous error message.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetError
member.summary: Use this function to retrieve a message about the last error that occurred.
member.returns: Returns a message with information about the specific error that occurred, or an empty string if there hasn't been an error since the last call to . Without calling , the message is only applicable when an SDL function has signaled an error. You must check the return values of SDL function calls to determine when to appropriately call . This string is statically allocated and must not be freed by the application.
member.remarks: It is possible for multiple errors to occur before calling SDL_GetError(). Only the last error is returned.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_SetError(System.String,)
member.summary: Use this function to set the SDL error string.
member.param: a printf() style message format string
additional parameters matching % tokens in the fmt string, if any
member.remarks: Calling this function will replace any previous error message that was set.

member.name: T:SDL2.SDL.SDL_version
member.summary: A structure that contains information about the version of SDL in use.
member.remarks: Represents the library's version as three levels:
major revision (increments with massive changes, additions, and enhancements)
minor revision (increments with backwards-compatible changes to the major revision), and
patchlevel (increments with fixes to the minor revision)
can be used to populate this structure with information

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_VERSION(SDL2.SDL.SDL_version@)
member.summary: Use this macro to determine the SDL version your program was compiled against.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_VERSIONNUM(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this macro to convert separate version components into a single numeric value.
member.param: major version; reported in thousands place
minor version; reported in hundreds place
update version (patchlevel); reported in tens and ones places
member.remarks: This assumes that there will never be more than 100 patchlevels.
Example: SDL_VERSIONNUM(1,2,3) -> (1203)

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_VERSION_ATLEAST(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this macro to determine whether the SDL version compiled against is at least as new as the specified version.
member.returns: This macro will evaluate to true if compiled with SDL version at least X.Y.Z.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetVersion(SDL2.SDL.SDL_version@)
member.summary: Use this function to get the version of SDL that is linked against your program.
member.param: the structure that contains the version information
member.remarks: This function may be called safely at any time, even before SDL_Init().

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetRevision
member.summary: Use this function to get the code revision of SDL that is linked against your program.
member.returns: Returns an arbitrary string, uniquely identifying the exact revision of the SDL library in use.
member.remarks: The revision is a string including sequential revision number that is incremented with each commit, and a hash of the last code change.
Example: hg-5344:94189aa89b54
This value is the revision of the code you are linked with and may be different from the code you are compiling with, which is found in the constant SDL_REVISION.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetRevisionNumber
member.summary: Use this function to get the revision number of SDL that is linked against your program.
member.returns: Returns a number uniquely identifying the exact revision of the SDL library in use.
member.remarks: This is an incrementing number based on commits to hg.libsdl.org.

member.name: T:SDL2.SDL.SDL_BlendMode

member.name: T:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GLattr

member.name: T:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GLprofile

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_DisableScreenSaver
member.summary: Use this function to prevent the screen from being blanked by a screen saver.
member.remarks: If you disable the screensaver, it is automatically re-enabled when SDL quits.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_EnableScreenSaver
member.summary: Use this function to allow the screen to be blanked by a screen saver.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetClosestDisplayMode(System.Int32,SDL2.SDL.SDL_DisplayMode@,SDL2.SDL.SDL_DisplayMode@)
member.summary: Use this function to get the closest match to the requested display mode.
member.param: the index of the display to query
an structure containing the desired display mode
an structure filled in with the closest match of the available display modes
member.remarks: The available display modes are scanned and closest is filled in with the closest mode matching the requested mode and returned. The mode format and refresh rate default to the desktop mode if they are set to 0. The modes are scanned with size being first priority, format being second priority, and finally checking the refresh rate. If all the available modes are too small, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetCurrentDisplayMode(System.Int32,SDL2.SDL.SDL_DisplayMode@)
member.summary: Use this function to get information about the current display mode.
member.param: the index of the display to query
an structure filled in with the current display mode
member.returns: Returns 0 on success or a negative error code on failure; call for more information.
member.remarks: There's a difference between this function and when SDL runs fullscreen and has changed the resolution. In that case this function will return the current display mode, and not the previous native display mode.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetCurrentVideoDriver
member.summary: Use this function to return the name of the currently initialized video driver.
member.returns: Returns the name of the current video driver or NULL if no driver has been initialized.
member.remarks: There's a difference between this function and when SDL runs fullscreen and has changed the resolution. In that case this function will return the previous native display mode, and not the current display mode.

an SDL_Rect structure representing the area to lock for access; NULL to lock the entire texture

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetBasePath
member.summary:
Get the path where the application resides.
Get the "base path". This is the directory where the application was run from, which is probably the installation directory, and may or may not be the process's current working directory.
This returns an absolute path in UTF-8 encoding, and is garunteed to end with a path separator ('\\' on Windows, '/' most other places).
member.returns: string of base dir in UTF-8 encoding
member.remarks:
The underlying C string is owned by the application, and can be NULL on some platforms.
This function is not necessarily fast, so you should only call it once and save the string if you need it.
This function is only available in SDL 2.0.1 and later.

member.name: M:SDL2.SDL.SDL_GetPrefPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Get the user-and-app-specific path where files can be written.
Get the "pref dir". This is meant to be where users can write personal files (preferences and save games, etc) that are specific to your application. This directory is unique per user, per application.
This function will decide the appropriate location in the native filesystem create the directory if necessary, and return a string of the absolute path to the directory in UTF-8 encoding.
member.returns: UTF-8 string of user dir in platform-dependent notation. NULL if there's a problem (creating directory failed, etc).
member.remarks:
The underlying C string is owned by the application, and can be NULL on some platforms. .NET provides some similar functions.
This function is not necessarily fast, so you should only call it once and save the string if you need it.
This function is only available in SDL 2.0.1 and later.

member.summary: Get the current power supply details.
member.param: Seconds of battery life left. You can pass a NULL here if you don't care. Will return -1 if we can't determine a value, or we're not running on a battery.
Percentage of battery life left, between 0 and 100. You can pass a NULL here if you don't care. Will return -1 if we can't determine a value, or we're not running on a battery.
member.returns: The state of the battery (if any).
